thread.title: Tuminello to chair county's capital committee
thread.title_full: Tuminello to chair county's capital committee

author: Susan DeMar Lafferty
title: Tuminello to chair county's capital committee
text:
Tuminello to chair county's capital committee Supplied / HANDOUT Ray Tuminello - Original Credit: (Supplied / HANDOUT) Susan DeMar Lafferty , was selected as chairman of his panel's capital improvements committee.
He replaces Ragan Frietag, R-Wilmington, who is giving up her elected seat on the board to become the board's new chief of staff March 1. 
Tuminello, who has served on the board for three years, is a current member of the committee. His vice-chair will be Mike Fricilone, R-Homer Glen. 
He said he was asked to fill the chair slot by board Speaker Jim Moustis, R- Frankfort Township. 
The capital improvements committee is now overseeing the construction of the new public safety complex, and is preparing to build a new 10-story courthouse and a health department facility, funded with a $275 million bond issue. 
Tuminello said his goal is to complete those projects "on time and on budget." 
"I have been involved in construction my entire life," he said. 
He is the owner of a glass block manufacturing business in Morris. Prior to being appointed to the county board, he served as a New Lenox village trustee for 12 years, during which time the village built a new village hall, public works garage and police station. 
Tuminello also is the vice chair of the board's finance, and legislative and policy committees, and a member of the executive and land use committees. 
"I am confident Ray and Mike will continue to work with the county board and Executive's office to carry out these projects in the best interests of the people of Will County," said Freitag in a news release. "The safety of Will County employees and residents will always be our utmost concern." 
.
